p.s: In the following I will analyze the given scene by including the cinemativ devices which were used to present the protagonists'protagonist's boyfriend, Chris.
By mentioning the created effects, I will also be talking about how Chris gets presented as the popular student in the school and how everyone looks up to him.
The first few clips which introduce Chris as he is walking down the corridor are shown in variety of shots but mostly in a medium shot.
The camera is positioned on the same level as Chris, walking towards the camera and greeting his friends.
This gives the effect that he is a well-known, popular student everyone has no problem with.
TheresThere's a typical school atmosphere/setting and the many shot clips that try to catch him walking in every angle possible are also another argument for his popularity and status in school.
As the camera switches to Starr in a medium close-up of her face, the audience gets to see her body language and her thoughts through the voice over.
The music plays an important role as it fits and gives a nice contrast to her admiring Chris while he walks down the hallways perfectly.
When Chris notices her, the camera does a 180 degree side-turn to underline and express the different perspectives of the two.
Starr proceeds to turn to her locker and thatsthat's when we have a close-up of her face when Chris walks up behind her.
The camera looks like it's in her locker which means that the audience has a perfect sight of her expression when Chris puts the headphones on her.
We can see her hiding a smile and surpressing her emotions due to her still being mad at Chris.
After Starr confronts him, the audience gets to see an eagerness side of the overly-confident Chris as he tries to tell his side of the story.
Due to the close-ups being constantly switched to the othersother's face, we can read off the exact facial expressions and interpret or put them into order resulting the emotions.
Afterwards we can see a switch to another conversation which is about the new beat Chris made for Starr.
It's clear that he wants to impress her but after not getting so much out of Starr, he proceeds to turn on the music for everyone to hear and dances in front of everyone.
This is shown in a medium shot while putting his dance in slow-motion.
If one thinks more and tries to interpret this excerpt, you could say that this too shows his intensive popularity.
Even when doing such an embarassingembarrassing move/dance and on top of that for everyone to see, shows and visualizes that Chris would have been still supported and seen as funny.
Chris doesn't have to care about how he's seen in school because no matter what he does, he's still the popular guy.

This is an extreme contrast or antithesis to Starr's status or picture in school which she always has to think and care about just so nobody sees her as ghetto or the typical stereotype of black people.

Considering all aspects and points one can say that the director purposlypurposely put in all the right cinematic devices and effects in their right plac to make/show a contrast between the two considering their pictures in school.
